Institution: SCFMS - STATE COLLEGE OF FLORIDA, MANATEE-SARASOTA
Course Description: THIS COURSE REVIEWS THE ACCOUNTING MODEL, STATEMENT PREPARATION, CONCEPTS, STANDARDS, AND PRINCIPLES UNDERLYING THE MEASUREMENT AND REPORTING OF FINANCIAL POSITION.  FURTHER TOPICS INCLUDE ACCOUNTING INCOME, CASH, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES, PLANT AND EQUIPMENT, AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.DESCRIBE THE CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK OF ACCOUNTING.

2.DESCRIBE THE DEVELOPMENT OF GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES.

3.APPLY GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES TO SPECIFIC ACCOUNTING EVENTS.

4.PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

5.DESCRIBE ACCOUNTING INCOME.

6.DESCRIBE & PREPARE COMPUTATIONS INVOLVING THE TIME VALUE OF MONEY.

7.DESCRIBE THE NATURE AND COMPOSITION OF CASH AND APPLY THE THEORY FOR THE CONTROL OF CASH AND CASH EQUIVALENTS.

8.ANALYZE AND RECORD TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE AND NOTES RECEIVABLE.

9.DESCRIBE THE PROCEDURES AND RECORD ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR INVENTORIES.

10.DESCRIBE THE PROCEDURES AND RECORD ACTIVITIES RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR PROPERTY, PLANT AND EQUIPMENT.

11.ANALYZE, RECORD, AND SUMMARIZE ACTIVITIES RELATED TO INTANGIBLE ASSETS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
